messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] professional advice
messages.msgSnippet: ... I was thinking about what I wrote before I went to sleep last night, and it occured to me that I should have said medical adivce, not homeopathic advice.
messages.messageBody:
1/18/03 12:20:

> I get your point. I just wonder how can someone ask about homeopathy if they
> don't know what homeopathy can help with? Most people haven't even heard about
> homeopathy, ever. Others think it's good for colds and flus, because that's
> what they were told at their health food store. Everybody knows what a violin
> is...
>
I was thinking about what I wrote before I went to sleep last night, and it
occured to me that I should have said medical adivce, not homeopathic
advice. I was too tierd to get up and fix it. You are definitely right
that not everyone knows what it is, and hence couldn't ask directly about
it.

> Anyway, I won't post anymore, ok?

You've already said you wouldn't but you still are, so I'm assuming you LIKE
being here and have things to say. Joyce has made it clear that you are
welcome, and merely asked you to think about your style. I haven't
insinuated that you shouldn't post, and it wouldn't be my place to do so
anyway.

brenda
